p:
Although penta-coordinated silicon was previously observed in silicates
20– 24 , coesite-IV and coesite-V are the first experimentally observed silica polymorphs featuring SiO 5 polyhedra. There are two crystallographically distinctive penta-coordinated silicon atoms (Si4 and Si6) in coesite-IV and three (Si3, Si4, and Si6) in coesite-V (Fig. 2). Although the range of Si–O bond lengths and their average are similar for all SiO 5 polyhedra, the shape of the polyhedra varies considerably (Fig. 2), accommodating features common for a trigonal bipyramid and for a square pyramid.
